intro: Peucedanum mouterdei, commonly known as the Mouterde's cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive umbellate flowers. It is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe, particularly found in rocky and dry habitats. The plant features finely divided leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
